titles.title: To revoke a Public Land Order with respect to certain lands erroneously included in the Cibola National Wildlife Refuge, California.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries and Oceans.
Mr. Radanovich moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1101.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 109-157.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 109-172.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 273.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 12/7/2005--Public Law. Revokes Public Land Order 3442, dated August 21, 1964, insofar as it applies to specified lands in Imperial County, California (lands included in Cibola National Wildlife Refuge). Directs the Secretary of the Interior to resurvey and publish the new boundaries of the Refuge.
